thread.title: Nipplegate uncovered: how Janet Jackson's Super Bowl wardrobe malfunction changed the world, and gave us YouTube
thread.title_full: Nipplegate uncovered: how Janet Jackson's Super Bowl wardrobe malfunction changed the world, and gave us YouTube

author: Alice Vincent
title: Nipplegate uncovered: how Janet Jackson's Super Bowl wardrobe malfunction changed the world, and gave us YouTube
text:
Nipplegate uncovered: how Janet Jackson's Super Bowl wardrobe malfunction changed the world, and gave us YouTube Wardrobe malfunction: Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake perform during the 2004 Super Bowl Alice Vincent , Entertainment Writer 4 February 2017 • 3:30pm 
O n Sunday, Lady Gaga will take to the pitch of the NRG Stadium in Houston , Texas, and give what she’s promised will be a “tremendously athletic” half time show during the 2017 Super Bowl. Gaga is the third woman to dominate the show in as many years: last year Beyoncé caused national controversy with a Black Panthers -inspired performance, the year before Katy Perry was nearly outshone by a wayward-dancing man in a shark suit . 
It wasn’t always this way. The mid-to-late Noughties saw a string of safe, solid crowd-pleasing – and male – acts. The Who , Bruce Springsteen , Tom Petty, The Rolling Stones and Paul McCartney were all reeled in to deliver guaranteed controversy-free guitar rock. The reason? Janet Jackson’s left breast. 
For 9/16ths of a second in February, 2004, Jackson found herself exposed on stage to a viewing audience of 90 million people after Justin Timberlake , then a recent exile...
